formal_accuser.name: Laurent Jean Laurent and Nicolas le Guinet

confession.devil_appearance: dressed as a man clothed in black
confession.seduction_context: During lawsuit with late maire François Jennin, devil appeared around midday in her room, promised to help her win lawsuit

devil_mark.description: scratched her forehead to remove chrism

witnesses.name: Jean Molet

witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Wife of Jean Molet who gave house to Martin Thomas

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Martin Thomas
timeline.details: Laurent Jean Laurent and Nicolas le Guinet, maimbours of Corny, appear as parties formelles on behalf of 'une grande partie de la commune'

timeline.subject: Mengeatte Triboul veuve Antoine Harel
timeline.details: Around 7 p.m., as her supper was being brought, Mengeatte confessed

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Martin Thomas
timeline.details: Said she was about 60, native of Vilcey-sur-Trey, gave detailed life history

timeline.subject: Mengeatte Triboul veuve Antoine Harel
timeline.details: Retracted confession, said it was made 'par crainte qu'elle avoit d'estre mise au fond du fossé'

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Martin Thomas
timeline.details: Further questioning about reputation and conflicts

timeline.subject: Mengeatte Triboul veuve Antoine Harel
timeline.details: Renewed confession - admitted master Joly appeared, persuaded her to renounce God

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Martin Thomas
timeline.details: Confrontations continued - mostly with same witnesses, no additional information

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Martin Thomas
timeline.details: Questions about wax figures, cemetery bones, hail, various disputes

timeline.subject: Mengeatte Triboul veuve Antoine Harel
timeline.details: Confessed to being witch and attending sabbat twice (evening)

timeline.subject: Mengeatte Triboul veuve Antoine Harel
timeline.details: Said other witches wore masks but recognized Agathe because they went home together

timeline.subject: Agathe femme Martin Thomas
timeline.details: Procureur asks for death sentence with previous torture to discover names of accomplices

timeline.subject: Mengeatte Triboul veuve Antoine Harel
timeline.details: Final condemnation with marks of seven members of court, including maire Jean Petit, and signature of Mengeon Larchien

accomplices_named.name: Agathe femme Martin Thomas
accomplices_named.context: Mengeatte claimed they had beaten water together 2 years earlier to make hail and had been to sabbat together, went home together from sabbat

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbe femme Jean Moulet
notable_quotes.context: Barbe angry about Agathe being given house

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (as reported by Mengeatte)
notable_quotes.french: tu es bien desolée sy tu veux faire pour moy je te feray gagner ton proces
notable_quotes.english: you are very distressed if you will do for me I will make you win your lawsuit
notable_quotes.context: Devil's seduction of Mengeatte during lawsuit with maire

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeatte Triboul
notable_quotes.french: par crainte qu'elle avoit d'estre mise au fond du fossé ou d'aultre peine qu'on luy eust pu faire
notable_quotes.english: for fear that she had of being put at the bottom of the ditch or other punishment they could do to her
notable_quotes.context: Mengeatte explaining why she made initial confession

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeatte Triboul
notable_quotes.french: A dict l'avoir bien hay et que c'estoit en bonne cause
notable_quotes.english: Said she had indeed hated him and that it was for good cause
notable_quotes.context: Admitting hatred of Claudin Michiel who spread rumors about her

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeatte Triboul
notable_quotes.french: sy elle estoit prinse que se seroit la premiere qui en diroit contre elle
notable_quotes.english: if she was arrested that [Mariette] would be the first who would speak against her
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Mariette femme Regnauldin Grand Jean after quarrel

notable_quotes.speaker: Agathe (as reported)
notable_quotes.english: that she would die of hunger
notable_quotes.context: Mengeatte's distress during lawsuit with maire

relationships.evidence_text: first marriage with Claude Dieu, marchal, which only lasted 6 months
Second marriage was with Girard Thiry, manouvrier and fuzelier, with whom she spent 15 years at Vilcey
Mariette femme Martin Jean le Clercq
she and her son François were returning from Mey
she and daughter-in-law had quarrels when they called one another witch and 'ribaulde'
her daughter had told her that her husband would beat her if she came round their house

economic_context.details: Housing dispute - Jean Molet allowed Martin Thomas (Agathe's husband) to have a small house, which angered Molet's wife Barbe. Agathe complained about lacking means to take legal action when called witch. Mengeatte was involved in lawsuit with maire François Jennin. Agathe mentioned daughter said she would 'die of hunger' suggesting poverty.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Still-born children - first one, then following week two more
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Barbe angry about husband giving house to Martin Thomas, told Agathe she had bewitched her husband

harms_catalog.victim_name: children of Marie femme Pierron Maurice
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel with Marie, who ate one of cooked apples Agathe had taken to creigne
Quarrel, ate one of cooked apples Agathe had taken to creigne
Five years earlier told wife of Claudin Michiel that her husband had spread rumor about vines; admitted hating him
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft (though Mengeatte claims she gave him grease which cured him)
soup given 'par bonne amitié' which helped her recover
milk or soup given to girl

harms_catalog.harm_description: Hurt his leg by falling from a tree
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Agathe took him to court for insults
Lawsuit between Agathe and 'a wicked woman' (Margueritte Tribou)
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Said if lawsuit had been terminated they would not have suffered hail

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Mengeatte Triboul and Agathe femme Martin Thomas

harms_catalog.method_alleged: Agathe allegedly said they should make an offering or she could do it for them

material_culture.context: Agathe advised making wax figure to take to Madame St Cire to prevent future still-births
Agathe took cooked apples to creigne; Marie ate one and became ill
Agathe took bones from cemetery when husband had 'la fourchette avalée'
Three heaps of powder found on Mengeatte's doorstep which turned into vermin, they burned it
Mengeatte gave Claudin Michiel grease she had bought to cure his bad leg
Mengeatte made soup for Barbe femme Claudin Michiel 'par bonne amitié' and she recovered; daughter wouldn't drink soup Agathe made during pregnancy
Mengeatte allegedly gave milk to daughter of Claudin Michiel who became ill
Mengeatte gave daughter-in-law an old chemise before arrest, said could send another in prison
Agathe's husband's shirt caught fire while she was drying it after his bath
Agathe's daughter didn't want her to touch their bread
Daughter didn't want to keep linen together with Agathe's
Other witches at sabbat wore masks so Mengeatte couldn't recognize them

Where witches had been burned; Claudin Michiel told Mengeatte she was a witch after these executions
Location where Agathe took cooked apples; where incident involving Barbe femme Claudin Michiel occurred; where daughter-in-law and others spoke about Mengeatte
Where Agathe took bones to see about husband's condition
Claudin Michiel spread rumor they would be spoiled except his; questions about what Agathe was doing in vines before hail
Where wax child figure should be taken (possibly a shrine or religious location)
Cat jumped in Mengeatte's face out of this garden

prior_legal_disputes.description: Agathe took Martin Thomas to court for insults

prior_legal_disputes.description: Martin Thomas was at law with Mengeatte

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Mengeatte confessed around 7 p.m. as her supper was being brought; retracted confession saying it was made 'par crainte qu'elle avoit d'estre mise au fond du fossé ou d'aultre peine'

Accused had remarked she had given her old chemise, knew she would be arrested, could send another in prison
Mother told Mengeatte she was cause of daughter's death

emotional_state_notes: Mengeatte: fear of punishment led to initial confession
Mengeatte: became 'as if rabid, scratching the ground' during lawsuit with maire
Mengeatte: angry after daughter-in-law spoke about her at creigne
Mengeatte: if strong enough would have thrown herself in Claudin Michiel's face
Agathe: called her daughter 'une mauvaise fille'

Agathe denied being cause of Marie's illness from eating apple

extraction_metadata.notes: This trial involves two accused women: Agathe femme Martin Thomas and Mengeatte Triboul veuve Antoine Harel. The outcome is clearly death for Mengeatte (final condemnation Oct 5, 1596), but uncertain for Agathe - the procureur requested death sentence with torture on Oct 2, but no further documents survive, so actual outcome unknown. I've marked outcome as 'death' based on the pattern and request, but this should be flagged as uncertain for Agathe specifically. Mengeatte confessed, retracted, then renewed confession, naming Agathe as accomplice at sabbat. Agathe maintained denial throughout. The trial shows typical patterns of reputation evidence, quarrels preceding harms, and economic marginality. Note: 'creigne' appears to be a communal gathering place but exact nature unclear. Some witness details limited as document summarizes '16 confrontations in all' without full details for each. The phrase 'la fourchette avalée' is unclear - possibly refers to specific medical condition. Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: Agathe lacking means for legal action, housing disputes, Mengeatte's fear of starvation. Healing practices: Agathe advised wax figure remedy and cemetery bones, categorized as healing though magical in nature.
